title: Browns' Odell Beckham Jr. not pleased with $14K fine for pants that were too short
text:
USA TODAY

Odell Beckham Jr. has been fined more than $14,000 for violating the league's uniform policy. The Cleveland Browns wide receiver wants everyone who follows him on Instagram to know how he feels about it.

Beckham Jr. posted a screenshot Monday of the letter he received from the NFL on Oct. 16, which revealed a fine of $14,037 for wearing pants that "failed to cover the knee area" against the Seattle Seahawks on Oct. 13.

"14k for some pants that are NOT gonna protect me from anything ... this shxt is ridiculous," he captioned the post.

Earlier this month, Beckham Jr. sounded off against the league when he received a separate fine for fighting the Baltimore Ravens' Marlon Humphrey. He also alluded to the pants rule that the league eventually fined him for.

"The NFL finds ways to just take it (money). They're going to take it from you. I understand a penalty, getting fined for that. But pants above the knees, a shirt hanging out, and you're getting $5,000 taken from you? Pads above your knees? You really think that this little knee pad covering my kneecap is going to affect, if somebody hits me, weighs 250 pounds, running 18 mph.

"I don't do physics, but if I get hit, this is not going to protect me. It's just stuff like that. I feel like we can come to a better agreement and simplifying things and not taking the money out of the pockets of the players who are putting money into this entire game."

Contributing: Associated Press
description: Cleveland Browns receiver Odell Beckham Jr. let everyone on Instagram know how he felt about being fined $14,000 by the league.
